resources.string:
Blipsqueak allows you to set different notification sounds for different types of messages by creating profiles that scan the text of incoming notifications for certain patterns and playing an associated sound if the pattern is matched. 

 First, Blipsqueak has to have access to read your notifications. Then, you can choose which apps will trigger the custom sounds. Set up a few profiles with patterns and sounds and then wait for notifications to come in or test your profiles directly. 

 To prevent your notifications from triggering multiple sounds simultaneously, you can either set each selected app's notifications to be silent or delay Blipsqueak's notifications by a second or two in settings. 

 More detailed help is available on other screens, or feel free to use the "Contact" option if you have any questions.
Only apps that are selected here will be able to trigger Blipsqueak\u00A0sounds. Blipsqueak scans the text from their notifications to see if it matches any of the profiles you\'ve set up.

This is the list of all the profiles you've created. Tap the floating action button to add a profile, drag the handles to reorder, and swipe from left to right to delete. 

 Order matters: messages are scanned against each profile in the order listed here, and the first one that matches is triggered. Organize them from specific to general for the best results. 

 If you want Blipsqueak to make a default sound when notifications don't match the rest of your profiles, make the very last profile on your list match any message and set your default sound there.

To add your own sounds to the list: 

 Find or make a folder called "Notifications" on your SD card or built-in storage, then copy any sound files you wish to use as notifications into it. Android supports mp3, wav, m4a, and ogg file types. 


 "Match all patterns" will only match messages where all of the profile's patterns match 

 "Match any pattern" requires only one pattern to match 


 Pattern types: 

 - contains or does not contain word/phrase: matches messages which contain or don't contain the exact given word or phrase with word boundaries on either side (for example, "no" would only match the whole word "no" and not any other word containing it such as "snow") 

 - contains or does not contain character sequence: matches messages which contain or do not contain the exact given sequence of characters - whether it's a whole word or not (in this case, "no" would match "snow") - use this option to match emoji 

 - starts with/ends with: matches messages that start or end with the exact given sequence of characters 

 - number of words/characters: matches messages that have the given number of words or characters (use one number to match exactly that many words/characters or two numbers separated by a comma to match any number of words/characters between those two - you can even use ",4" for less than 4 or "6," for more than six) 

 - matches exactly: matches only messages whose content is exactly the given text 

 - matches any message: will match a message no matter the text (used to set a default sound when no other profiles are matched) 

 - matches regular expression: matches messages that match the given Java regular expression (advanced, see the Java regular expression documentation for more details)
